newsitem.title: USA: Lip imprint helps convict Chicago murderer.
newsitem.headline: Lip imprint helps convict Chicago murderer.

text.p: The murderer's lip imprint on a roll of tape -- which police evidence technicians said was as distinctive as a fingerprint -- helped convict a 23-year-old man in a shotgun slaying, prosecutors said on Tuesday.

Partly on the strength of the roll of duct tape found at the murder scene, a Kane County jury convicted Lavelle Davis on Monday in the 1993 slaying of Patrick Ferguson as the 30-year-old victim's children watched.
Police said Davis left his imprint on the tape while rehearsing a planned robbery in which the tape was to have been used to bind and gag the intended victim.
